page.title: 11RURAL AREAS OF STAINLAND
page.content: {Broom Hill}nearby is an unmade road over a mile long with just five houses alongside it. In bad winters people who live there need a Landrover if they want to get to work. {Krumlin }is on a hill top on the other side of the valley from Broomhill.It is more sheltered and has proper roads.It is a small hamlet. {Branch Road}is in the bottom of the valley.It is a sheltered place and trees grow well.The houses are few and far between. Nearly all the houses in these areas are over a hundred years old.Most have been fully restored.Many of the small farmhouses have been modernised and are owned by people who commute to Manchester or Leeds. The countryside around here is beautiful and is ideal for walkers or cyclists.
